p: The first virus isolated from the 2002 outbreak of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) was designated SARS‐CoV. 3 The other coronavirus that causes severe illness in humans has been designated Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Corona Virus (MERS‐CoV). MERS‐CoV resulted in severe disease in Saudi Arabia in 2014 with a very high death rate of about 34% of those infected 4. The first SARS outbreak in 2002 had a death rate of about 10%. Fortunately, the death rate of the COVID‐19 outbreak seems to be much lower, at about 2.0% worldwide. 5
